intro: Perezia sublyrata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf perezia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is a perennial herb that produces bulbs, which are essential for its survival and propagation. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
